crnrstn_element.crnrstn_description:
When seeking to determine whether or not a particular PHP SESSION parameter has been set, the issetSessionParam() method of the session_manager :: class can provide all of the required insight without burdening the application with unnecessary encrypt/decrypt processing.
As opposed to checking for getSessionParam() != ''...for example...which may force the application to swallow an mcrypt cipher decryption request (assuming CRNRSTN has been configured with encryption via initSessionEncryption()), issetSessionParam() is the recommended and more efficient method for arriving at the same conclusion.

crnrstn_techspecscontent.crnrstn_techspec: It is recommended that you upgrade to the latest version of PHP to take advantage of the latest gains in security and processing efficiency.
Currently tested on an ubuntu 4.2 server running PHP Version 5.2.6 and Apache 2.2.11

crnrstn_parameter.crnrstn_paramdefinition: The name of the parameter that is stored in the PHP SESSION.
